text: Jean-Louis Vaudoyer (10 September 1883 20 May 1963) was a French novelist, poet, essayist, and art historian. He was administrator general of the Comédie-Française (1941–1944). He was a member of the Académie française (1950–1963). He wrote the libretto for Le Spectre de la rose, a ballet choreographed by Michel Fokine for Diaghilev's Ballets Russes in 1911. == Other websites == *Académie française Category:1883 births Category:1963 deaths Category:French novelists Category:French poets Category:French essayists Category:French historians Category:Librettists Category:Members of the Académie française
title: Jean-Louis Vaudoyer
